intro: Neea shaferi, commonly known as the Shafer's nee, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of China. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes heathers and blueberries, and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in acidic, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, moist environments. Its botanical features include narrow, leathery leaves and bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale pink. Neea shaferi is relatively rare and is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
